column2: ENGLISH
As I rode my horse through the countryside, out of the corner of my eye I spotted a sword...
By Tengri, the Sword of Attila!
Talks have been happening about my fight with the dragon...
The sword I used has become famous!
A giant of the lands has approached with a giant club, challenging my rule of the realm!
Drive my sword through his heart!
Run away!
As ruler of England, I should have a ceremonial sword used for coronations.
I shall call you, Curtana!
As ruler of Poland, I should have a ceremonial sword used for coronations.
I shall call you, Szczerbiec!
As ruler of Hungary, I should have a crown used for coronations.
The Holy Crown of Hungary!

As you make your way through the woods on a minor hunting trip for rabbits, you come across an old man sitting outside of a humble cottage. By his side is a sword looking like none other you have ever seen. As you approach, he hails, "Hello there! My name is Rhydderch Hael!"
What's that sword?
We're just passing by.
Kill and rob him.
This thing? I call her Dyrnwyn! Very fine sword indeed! Been with me for quite some time now! he states with a smile.
May I have Dyrnwyn?
May I purchase Dyrnwyn from you?
Very nice sword! We must be off now.
Well sure, I don't see why not! he says, his smile growing larger, as he holds the sheathed sword out towards you.
Take the sword, Dyrnwyn, and thank him.

As you unsheathe the sword, the blade bursts into flames from the base to the tip! You look back to Rhydderch, but he is gone, and so is his cottage. All you see before you is a cleared section in the forest...
Mysterious indeed...

As I walk near the stream, a lost memory rushes to my mind filling me with a wondrous sense of lucidity. When I was just a newborn, I was taken in for a short period of time by fairies. Before they sent me on my way, they told me where they hid a magical artifact that would help me later in life...
Yes! Underneath this rock!
